decks.notes: The deck revolves around an aggressive strategy focusing on the commander Cloud, Midgar Mercenary. The deck includes various cards to support the aggro playstyle, such as equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine, as well as creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Giver of Runes to control the board. The deck also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile to deal with threats efficiently. With a mix of creatures, equipment, and support spells, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays while utilizing Cloud's abilities to their fullest potential.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, all while protecting your own board and maintaining control of the game. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd serves as the commander, providing a powerful boost to your creatures and enabling you to create a threatening board presence quickly. The deck includes various efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats from the opponent, as well as disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down their game plan. With a mix of aggro creatures, removal, and protection spells, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats. By leveraging Cloud, Midgar Mercenary as the commander, the deck aims to apply pressure early on while also having access to powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to increase the effectiveness of its creatures in combat. The inclusion of cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Ranger-Captain of Eos further disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile provide efficient removal. Overall, the deck seeks to establish early dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful card draw options. Elminster is used as the commander to provide additional control elements and card advantage. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells like Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Mana Leak to disrupt opponents' plans. Removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of God help deal with opposing threats. Card draw spells like Archmage's Charm and Brainstorm ensure a steady stream of resources. The deck aims to outlast opponents by controlling the board state and card advantage until it can secure a win condition.

The deck revolves around maintaining control over the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Elminster's ability to generate card advantage and manipulate the board state allows the deck to consistently answer threats and disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck includes a variety of counterspells like Force of Negation, Mana Leak, and Cryptic Command to stop key spells from resolving. Removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of God help deal with opposing creatures and threats. Card advantage engines like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Mystic Sanctuary ensure the deck can maintain its resources and outvalue opponents. Overall, the deck focuses on outlasting opponents and controlling the game until it can win with its own threats.

The deck revolves around maximizing the efficiency of spells and countering opponents' plays while maintaining card advantage through card selection and manipulation. With Lier, Disciple of the Drowned as the commander, the deck focuses on a combination of control elements and card draw to ensure that the player can consistently cast spells and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of additional cards that help find key pieces, such as Spellseeker and Merchant Scroll, allows for flexibility in adapting to different game situations. By utilizing a high number of counterspells and draw spells, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents while setting up for powerful win conditions like Brain Freeze or Cryptic Command.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent by disrupting their plays with counterspells and bounce effects while digging through the deck for important cards using card draw and manipulation spells. The goal is to slow down the opponent's game plan enough to allow Lier, Disciple of the Drowned to take over the game with its powerful abilities and spells. With a heavy emphasis on instants and sorceries, the deck aims to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for a big finish with high impact spells. By efficiently managing resources and outmaneuvering the opponent, this deck looks to secure victory by overwhelming them with a flurry of powerful spells and forced misplays.

The deck focuses on utilizing counterspells, card draw, and control spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a combo win condition. With Lier, Disciple of the Drowned as the commander, the deck aims to control the board by countering threats and bouncing key cards back to the opponent's hand. The inclusion of bounce spells like Into the Flood Maw and Repeal, along with additional turn spells like Time Warp, allows for extra turns to set up the win condition. The deck also includes card selection and tutoring spells to find combo pieces quickly. The goal is to outmaneuver the opponent and overwhelm them with a combo finish.
